column1: There’s no doubt that small businesses are among the hardest hit by coronavirus.  On this Small Business Saturday let’s take the opportunity to say thank you to the many businesses in #FL18 that make our community so great! https://t.co/0WpZCF5wPj

The application for Palm Beach County Mortgage Assistance Program which is funded by Congress in the CARES Act has officially launched! Assistance is available up to $10000 for eligible homeowners impacted by COVID-19. Learn more and apply here: https://t.co/yho2arJP8S

ICYMI → The House Foreign Affairs Committee has found clear evidence that China’s attempted cover-up of the coronavirus is directly responsible for this devastating pandemic. The Chinese Communist Party must be held accountable for their actions! https://t.co/IwU4jdsJs5

The final Congressional report on the origins of COVID-19 leaves no room for doubt: China’s attempted cover up turned a local infection into a global pandemic. The Chinese government must be held accountable! https://t.co/BmrUFAdxe5
Brianna and I are praying for a speedy recovery for President Trump the First Lady and everybody fighting coronavirus!

The application for Palm Beach County Restart Business Grants which is funded by Congress in the CARES Act has resumed! Grants are up to $25k for PB County businesses & can be used to cover payroll/rent/other expenses related to COVID. Learn more here: https://t.co/so9p9bQ3xH

ICYMI → Congress passed important legislation this week to help small businesses in our community lead the way as we recover from the impacts of the coronavirus. Read more here: https://t.co/pl6gszWpVF

Now more than ever we need to support the entrepreneurs and the small business leaders who are helping our economy recover from the coronavirus pandemic. The good news is that Congress passed two bills this week to do just that. Watch now: https://t.co/l7XyS9ah8g
Wishing everyone in #FL18 a happy Labor Day especially those frontline workers who continue serving our community as we battle the coronavirus! https://t.co/JTe1LgpLPq

Some people are calling the coronavirus pandemic an “Act of God” but the truth is that it could have been avoided if not for the gross negligence of China’s communist government. We must hold them accountable for their crimes! Watch more: https://t.co/Q8BOQaVTzw

China’s mishandling of the coronavirus has caused a devastating pandemic around the globe. We must hold the Chinese government accountable for lying to the rest of the world and trying to cover up their mistakes! https://t.co/Wmi5jXMDQI

Don’t let this week’s political stunt by Nancy Pelosi fool you: it’s designed to hide the fact that she's actually cut more working days from the Congressional calendar while she stonewalls efforts to pass a bipartisan coronavirus relief package. We need to get back to work! https://t.co/TmE96MMiFw

Since becoming law the Paycheck Protection Program has saved 65726 jobs in Florida’s 18th District and helped businesses across our community weather the coronavirus. Read more about it here: https://t.co/AKRFTM4Ib6

🚨Thanks to the Paycheck Protection Program more than 38000 people were able to keep their jobs during coronavirus in Palm Beach County! 🚨 This program which Congress passed as part of the CARES Act has been a critical resource for so many in our community. https://t.co/0DcoAFZwce

This week I helped introduce legislation to support small businesses urged my colleagues to hold China accountable for their mishandling of the coronavirus and more! Check out this week’s Week In Review: https://t.co/0WUAlHKm9b

ICYMI - I introduced legislation to help businesses in our community that have been hit hardest by coronavirus reopen their doors in a way that is safe for everyone. Read the bill: https://t.co/c7AzqWbd0h

China’s mishandling of the coronavirus cost thousands of lives millions of jobs and left untold economic destruction. I testified today that we have an obligation to hold them accountable for their corrupt cover-up! https://t.co/Ji5TYfuEpL

Nobody should be punished for taking money out of their retirement savings to make ends meet as a result of coronavirus. That’s why I’m urging leaders of both parties to support my Fairness for Early Withdrawers Act to protect your retirement savings! https://t.co/emMvLjSuAl

Last week I introduced the Fairness for Early Withdrawers Act to protect retirement savings.  Nobody should be punished for taking money out of their retirement savings to make ends meet as a result of coronavirus! https://t.co/pfvtUxkeIh

Coronavirus has had a devastating financial impact on so many in our community especially those forced to take money from their retirement savings to make ends meet. That’s why I introduced the bipartisan FEW Act to protect your savings. Read the bill: https://t.co/ouLe7QncIQ

Coronavirus has caused enough financial stress in our community. No one should be punished for taking money out of their retirement savings just to buy groceries or pay rent. That’s why I introduced the Fairness for Early Withdrawers Act to protect your retirement savings: https://t.co/3ywc9MIl52

Due to coronavirus we have moved the deadline to submit your artwork for the 2020 Congressional Art Competition! All submissions are due by June 3rd at 12pm for the chance to have your artwork hung in the U.S. Capitol! Learn more here: https://t.co/6C1rw0J4hb

I joined @CBS12 yesterday to discuss the latest on coronavirus - how my office can help with unemployment assistance small business assistance individual assistance and so much more. You can check it out here! ⤵️ https://t.co/nRQtgTffLC

These young men represent everything that our community is all about! I could not be more proud of them for their efforts to raise money and donate meals to front line workers and first responders during the coronavirus pandemic. This is a great read! https://t.co/uFYsLwzCDs

The application for Palm Beach County Restart Business Grants (funded by Congress in the CARES Act) is now open! Grants are available up to $25k and can be used to cover payroll rent & other expenses related to COVID-19. Learn more and apply here: https://t.co/TWT115U5r1

The Coronavirus Food Assistance Program is available to help provide direct relief to farmers in our community who are battling price declines & additional marketing costs due to COVID-19. You can check your eligibility for this financial assistance here: https://t.co/f2A0n74qLF

Florida/@GovRonDeSantis were ridiculed by the same media that praised NY Governor Andrew Cuomo.  New York has 350000+ coronavirus cases (23.5% positivity rate) while Florida has less than 50000 (6.1% positivity rate). And people wonder where the distrust in media comes from...

Over the last several weeks my office has received thousands of questions covering a wide range of coronavirus response related topics. Here are some of the most common Frequently Asked Questions to date: https://t.co/vd282AXLbS

Coronavirus has resulted in the hardest working people being asked something never before seen: don’t go to work. My goal is to turn that around & find every job out there to fill w/ someone looking for work! Starting right now w/ our new virtual job fair: https://t.co/DzeXL4gK7K
❗Using the coronavirus pandemic as cover special interest groups are attempting to hijack Florida’s water for their own profit.❗  I will not let that happen! ➡️https://t.co/urAn0rn0Xs

Today is #NationalNursesDay.  I hope we can all give a HUGE thank you to every one of the nurses out there on the front line of the coronavirus battle! Each day you put it all on the line to protect our families and community. We appreciate all that you do. https://t.co/iL9pVkTwoR

Many businesses that have been severely impacted by coronavirus will qualify for two new employer tax credits put into place by Congress – the Credit for Sick and Family Leave and the Employee Retention Credit.  Learn more here: https://t.co/pvPNd79K4P
ICYMI → I introduced a resolution this week to hold China accountable for their intentional deception regarding the coronavirus that has cost our country so much. Read more: https://t.co/DhwNXpNrfq
The White House has put together a blueprint for states across the country to begin re-opening with expanded coronavirus testing: https://t.co/yaAw9bXCYp

The Department of Housing and Urban Development just announced that our community is receiving more than $1 million in additional funding to support public housing during the coronavirus as a result of passing the CARES Act: https://t.co/ffR3HLq4LD
(2/2) Here’s a video that I think is useful in explaining how the coronavirus response bills that have been passed work: https://t.co/XhhntT6TT3

Palm Beach County Youth Services will be distributing meals to children impacted by the coronavirus next week. Meals will be available at various locations. More information about the program can be found here: https://t.co/BvYyjqpKq7

I’ve compiled a list of important coronavirus information for families seniors veterans business owners and more. Read more here and please do not hesitate to call at 202-225-3026 if you have any questions: https://t.co/yzOGatN1tU

@geogirlErin There are policies in place to limit the number of individuals in the chamber and restrict the flow of people to ensure everybody can stay socially distant.  We can take these precautions and do the business of the American people.  That's what we were elected to do.

@RealKdawg64 I agree with you but to clarify the money to Harvard is not from the PPP & the majority of it is to be distributed directly to students impacted by coronavirus. College students got left out of individual stimulus checks (which I disagree with) and they need the support also.
China’s total lack of transparency and mishandling of the coronavirus outbreak has cost tens of thousands of lives millions of jobs and left untold economic destruction.

Like so many in our community fishermen are feeling the negative economic impact of the coronavirus. I fought hard to secure funding for our fishing industry in the CARES Act & now I’m urging Secretary Ross to ensure this support gets to those who need it most! Read our letter: https://t.co/H9XP4Y5Pg2

I spoke with @GovRonDeSantis today about the failures with unemployment. He has appointed a new leader to oversee coronavirus unemployment response & committed to working with me to make sure it works. The fight continues - please do not hesitate to reach out at 202-225-3026! https://t.co/wuuMtpcaVL

Due to the coronavirus @POTUS has extended the deadline to file federal taxes (which would normally be today) to July 15 w/ no penalty. The IRS has also just launched a new tool for you to check the status of your economic impact payment. Learn more here: https://t.co/o5o4iBguuG

I spoke with @foxandfriends this morning from my kitchen because Speaker Pelosi is refusing to bring the House of Representatives into session to debate and vote on improvements to the coronavirus response.  There is work to do and a mission to accomplish.
I would rather succumb to the ails of COVID-19 than fail to serve when I asked and was chosen to do so.  It’s time for Congress to get back to work! https://t.co/xGKdLdy6Mh

As a result of legislation passed by Congress the Department of Health and Human Services is sending more than $4.5 million to health centers in Palm Beach County this week. These funds will be used to detect prevent and treat the coronavirus! https://t.co/Y7Ug4p7pig

With this week being Public Health Week I wanted to pause for a second to give a HUGE thank you to all of the doctors nurses first responders and volunteers who continue to combat the coronavirus on the front lines. You are all heroes and our community is grateful! https://t.co/yHdbC3lM4V

There have been increased reports of scammers trying to use the coronavirus to take advantage of people while they’re distracted. Check out these tips on how you can protect yourself & share with people who may be susceptible to these types of scams! https://t.co/aT71T2S9fM

I’ve compiled a list of coronavirus resources including answers to Frequently Asked Questions (for individuals small businesses and more).  Take a look and if you have any questions do not hesitate to reach out at 202-225-3026! https://t.co/yzOGatN1tU

With everything going on we need #FACTSnotFEAR.  Making the choice to keep our distance from one another will help us defeat the coronavirus. Social distancing is the right thing to do to keep everyone in our community healthy. https://t.co/bOjK33zbO1

Please note: if your flight was cancelled or significantly delayed because of COVID-19 you are entitled to a full refund. If your airline offers only a travel voucher or credit for future travel the airline is in violation of federal law.  See more here: https://t.co/lJ78Rxikbu

Thank you to Governor DeSantis who has just signed an executive order suspending mortgage foreclosures and evictions related to coronavirus for the next 45 days. No family should have to worry about losing the roof over their head during this crisis! https://t.co/MhRgmSn9mO

The FL Dept. of Health is accepting volunteer medical professionals in St. Lucie county to help combat coronavirus. If you're a doctor nurse EMT or other expert & you want to help combat coronavirus on the front lines click here to learn more/register: https://t.co/HNM8AjZglN

It's beyond the pale that the Kennedy Center has laid off hundreds of employees after receiving $25 mil in stimulus money (that never should have been in the bill in the first place)!   I’ve added my name to a bill to rescind this money & put it to good use combating coronavirus! https://t.co/AocfzRUTKW

Last week we passed legislation to respond to the coronavirus & as a result @HUDgov is awarding more than $5.2 million in funding to our communities. These funds can be used to address coronavirus impacts limiting the spread and reducing financial distress among the homeless. https://t.co/6pmXF9I8eT
